title: axum-core 0.2.9 & axum 0.5.17
body:
## Motivation

Make some of the improvements since axum-core 0.2.8 & axum 0.5.17 available ahead of the 0.6.0 release which looks like it will still take a little while.

## Solution

Backport bug fixes, doc improvements and some simple feature PRs.

title: Add Error::into_inner
body:
## Motivation

Allows one to convert `axum::response::Response` to a similar boxed-body response type not tied to axum-core (if you want to be able to bump axum without that being a breaking change) without allocating.

title: Expand static file serving example
body:
This expands the static file serving example to cover more of the questions we often get.

Once 0.6 is out I wanna work more on tower-http and in particular make `ServeDir` easier to use so we can just delete `SpaRouter`.

title: Relax bounds for `FromExtractor`
body:
We didn't actually use the bounds. I guess they were left over from a previous version.

Fixes #1467

title: Document `RouterService`
body:
Not sure what else there is to say :P

Fixes https://github.com/tokio-rs/axum/issues/1401

title: Improve `map_response` docs
body: Follow up to https://github.com/tokio-rs/axum/pull/1414 which improves the docs.

title: Don't allow extracting `MatchedPath` in middleware for nested routes
body:
This changes `MatchedPath` so it cannot be extracted in middleware of nested routes. This means users wont see the internal wildcard route (`/nested/*__private__axum_nest_tail_param`) that actually matched. This is an implementation detail and shouldn't be exposed.

I didn't make `MatchedPath` accessible in response extensions like discussed in https://github.com/tokio-rs/axum/issues/1441 because thats not a breaking change and shouldn't block shipping 0.6.0

I also reworked the tests so there are multiple smaller tests instead of one big one. Should be easier to read.

Part of https://github.com/tokio-rs/axum/issues/1441

title: Document differences between `DefaultBodyLimit` and `RequestBodyLimit`
body: Part of https://github.com/tokio-rs/axum/issues/1409

title: Don't internally `Arc` the state
body: The fact that the state is `Arc`'ed internally in `Router` has caused confusion for several people. I've been thinking about and think we should remove the `Arc` and give the users the choice to `Arc` things or not.

title: Use RequestPartsExt more in docs / examples
Start second server on different port for metrics endpoint
body:
<!--
Thank you for your Pull Request. Please provide a description above and review
the requirements below.

Bug fixes and new features should include tests.

Contributors guide: https://github.com/tokio-rs/axum/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md
-->

## Motivation

The `prometheus-metrics` example makes the `/metrics` endpoint publicly available.


## Solution

As discussed in #1443, this change starts a second server on a different port for the `/metrics` endpoint.

title: Fix typo in example
body: Fix a typo in example comment.

title: Improve the error message for state type inference failure in FromRequest(Parts) derive macro
body: Happy to do similar things for other macro errors, if somebody writes a test case with a suboptimal error message 🙂

title: Add `#[derive(FromRef)]`
body:
Given how straight forward this is I think it makes sense to support.

## TODO

title: Fix Cached<T> as the last argument of a handler function
body: The `FromRequest` and `FromRequestParts` impls for Cached were both applying for the last handler argument (`FromRequestParts` was through the blanket implementation of `FromRequest` for `T: FromRequestParts`). We should only have a separate `FromRequest` impl for a generic extractor when it has a bound on an inner type implementing `FromRequest` (i.e. one that isn't fulfilled by parts extractors that are covered by the `FromRequestParts` impl).

title: rmv claim that state can't be passed to middleware
body:
axum::middleware::from_fn_with_state now allows middleware to access application state.

<!--
Thank you for your Pull Request. Please provide a description above and review
the requirements below.

Bug fixes and new features should include tests.

Contributors guide: https://github.com/tokio-rs/axum/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md
-->

## Motivation
The docs currently state that the State extractor cannot be passed to middleware. axum::middleware::from_fn_with_state allows state to be passed to middleware, so the statement is either incorrect or at the least confusing. 
<!--
Explain the context and why you're making that change. What is the problem
you're trying to solve? If a new feature is being added, describe the intended
use case that feature fulfills.
-->

## Solution
Removed the statement.
<!--
Summarize the solution and provide any necessary context needed to understand
the code change.
-->

title: Update expected stderr of trybuild test
body: With Rust 1.64 released, it seems like something changed about error reporting again, so a trybuild test was failing.

title: Remove `ContentLengthLimit`
body:
Closes #1399

Before I continue I wanted to ask if the implementation should live in the `Bytes` extractor, and if so should we also check the method like `ContentLengthLimit` impl used to? If the impl should live in in the Bytes extractor what with rejections, should I just extend it with the required fields or maybe add one variant to `BytesRejection` named something like `BodyLimitRejection` and store more detailed rejection inside that variant?

title: Add example showing how to return `anyhow::Error`s
body: I think this makes sense to have an example for since its a recurring question we get on Discord.

title: Add `DefaultBodyLimit::max` to change the body size limit
body:
Fixes https://github.com/tokio-rs/axum/issues/1370

We now have a few ways to set body limits:
- The new `DefaultBodyLimit::max`
- `ContentLengthLimit`
- `tower_http::limit::RequestBodyLimit` and `http_body::Limited`

I don't we should remove anything tower-http and http-body but I feel we should consider removing `ContentLengthLimit`. It can essentially be replaced with

```rust
Router::new().route(
    "/",
    post(handler.layer(DefaultBodyLimit::max(new_limit))),
);
```

title: Add `middleware::from_extractor_with_state`
body: Fixes https://github.com/tokio-rs/axum/issues/1373

title: Support `State` with `#[derive(FromRequest[Parts])]`
body:
Fixes https://github.com/tokio-rs/axum/issues/1314

This makes it possible to extract things via `State` in `#[derive(FromRequet)]`:

```rust
#[derive(FromRequet)]
#[from_request(state(AppState))]
struct Foo {
    state: State<AppState>,
}
```

The state can also be inferred in a lot of cases so you only need to write:

```rust
#[derive(FromRequet)]
struct Foo {
    // since we're using `State<AppState>` we know the state has to be
    // `AppState`
    state: State<AppState>,
}
```

Same for

```rust
#[derive(FromRequet)]
struct Foo {
    #[from_request(via(State))]
    state: AppState,
}
```

And

```rust
#[derive(FromRequet)]
#[from_request(via(State))]
struct AppState {}
```

I think I've covered all the edge cases but there are (unsurprisingly) a few.

## Todo

- [x] Test that these extractors can be combined with others in the same handler, ie that we don't get errors because of `M`

title: Add track_caller to route_with_tsr
body:
… and route_service_with_tsr.

Wanted to work on #1347 but other than finding this small improvement I wasn't *entirely* sure what to do / didn't have enough time 😅

title: Support streaming/chunked requests in `ContentLengthLimit`
body:
Now that `FromRequest` gets an owned `Request<B>` we can change the body type before calling some other extractor. Then `ContentLengthLimit` can apply `http_body::Limited` and limit the size of streaming/chunked requests which it previously couldn't.

Related to https://github.com/tokio-rs/axum/issues/1110#issuecomment-1248368803

title: Clarify `Clone` requirements for using `State`
body: Fixes https://github.com/tokio-rs/axum/issues/1374

title: Use `400 Bad Request` for `FailedToDeserializeQueryString` rejections
body:
Fixes https://github.com/tokio-rs/axum/issues/1378

From [the spec] about `422 Unprocessable Entity`:

> For example, this error condition may occur if an XML request body
> contains well-formed (i.e., syntactically correct), but semantically
> erroneous, XML instructions.

I understand this to mean that query params shouldn't use 422 because that is about the request body.

So this changes `FailedToDeserializeQueryString` from `422 Unprocessable Entity` to `400 Bad Request`.

[the spec]: https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc4918#section-11.2

title: Add tokio feature & make tokio optional for WASM support
body:
## Motivation

This PR is a continuation of @fisherdarling's [PR](https://github.com/tokio-rs/axum/pull/1054) since they are very busy and don't have time to see it through at the moment.

It allows Axum to be compiled to WASM, therefore, executable in a browser, Cloudflare Worker, etc...


## Solution

This PR adds a tokio feature that enables tokio as well as hyper/tcp and hyper/server. The tokio feature also enables SSE and extract::connect_info.

This is a breaking change since this breaks usages of default_features = false.

The first commit is not a breaking change and can thus be backported to 0.5.

Bug fixes and new features should include tests.

Contributors guide: https://github.com/tokio-rs/axum/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md

## Motivation

Previously, it was difficult to find out the path in the deep JSON tree at which a deserialization error occurred.

<!--
Explain the context and why you're making that change. What is the problem
you're trying to solve? If a new feature is being added, describe the intended
use case that feature fulfills.
-->

## Solution

This patch makes an error message to contain the errored path.  In order to find out the path, I added [serde_path_to_error](https://crates.io/crates/serde_path_to_error), a new optional dependency.

body:

I only ported `#[from_request(...)]`. Will port the rest in follow-up PRs.

title: Allow Routers to inherit state, take 2
body:
## Motivation

Closes https://github.com/tokio-rs/axum/issues/1326.

## Solution

Make `Router<S, _>` no longer a type that *necessarily* holds a state instance of type `S`. Instead, we track (at runtime, to avoid making the generics too complex) whether a given `Router` instance wants to inherit its state.

## Status

I implemented router merging which was much easier than splitting `nest` into `nest` and `nest_service`. The fallback handler (currently stubbed out) will also need some special handling, but I don't think it should be a showstopper.

body: Small things I found while working on #1326.

title: feat: Add axum-casbin-auth and axum-middleware-example
body:
<!--
Thank you for your Pull Request. Please provide a description above and review
the requirements below.

Bug fixes and new features should include tests.

Contributors guide: https://github.com/tokio-rs/axum/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md
-->

## Motivation
Currently, the rust version of Casbin is ready for production and we are developing the ecosystem around it. `axum-casbin-auth` uses Axum web framework to build a basic middleware which can handle requests with authorization control. It can basically read username, request path, request method and send enforce request to casbin enforcer for authorization.

`axum-middleware-example` is a simple example demonstrating the authorization using Casbin Axum Middleware.

<!--
Explain the context and why you're making that change. What is the problem
you're trying to solve? If a new feature is being added, describe the intended
use case that feature fulfills.
-->

## Solution
I wish to showcase these developments under axum ecosystem so that open source community can take benefit from it. Hence I have added pointers to them in ECOSYSTEM.md
<!--
Summarize the solution and provide any necessary context needed to understand
the code change.
-->

title: Add must_use attribute to Redirect type
body:
## Motivation

I just had somebody ask me for help with a redirect that wasn't working, turns out they just didn't return the `Redirect` from the handler.

## Solution

Have the compiler emit a warning if a `Redirect` goes unused.

title: Fixed docs for chained method routing
body:
Hey, thanks for the amazing work on this crate!

I was browsing the internals of the routing and found some incorrect public documentation for the chained method routing.

title: expose FromRequest and FromRequestParts macros in axum
body: I would expect to just `#[derive(FromRequest)]` if the `macros` feature is enabled, this tiny PR enables that.

title: Limit size of request bodies in `Bytes` extractor
body:
## Motivation

We recently received a report of a vulnerability in axum caused by `Bytes::from_request` calling [`hyper::body::into_bytes`](https://docs.rs/hyper/latest/hyper/body/fn.to_bytes.html) directly without setting a limit. This meant if someone sent an infinite request body the server would attempt to buffer the whole thing in memory and eventually OOM.

This also applies to extractors that calls `Bytes::from_request` internally like `String`, `Json`, and `Form`.

## Solution

I think the right move is to set a default limit on how much `Bytes::from_request` will consume. I don't think just documenting it is enough since users might not notice.

This PR fixes it by wrapping the body in [`http_body::Limited`](https://docs.rs/http-body/latest/http_body/struct.Limited.html) before calling `into_bytes`. This can be disabled by adding the new `DefaultBodyLimit::disable()` middleware. That sets a private extension which `Bytes::from_request` looks for.

Once this is merged I'll backport this to 0.5

title: Add `middleware::{from_fn_with_state, from_fn_with_state_arc}`
body: Makes running extractors like `PrivateCookieJar` and `State` easier from middleware created with async functions.

title: Improve opaque error message for `Handler::layer`
body:
Layers applied with `Hander::layer` must implement `Clone`. If they don't you get the familiar "Handler not implemented ..." error. Other methods like `Router::layer` doesn't require this and its pretty confusing why a layer would work on a router but not on a handler. I just spent an hour helping someone on Discord track this down 😅

The reason the `Handler::layer` requires `L: Clone` is that layers can only be applied to `Service`s and turning a `Handler` into a `Service` requires the state. We don't have the state yet in `Handler::layer` so instead we store the layer with the handler and apply the layer in `<Layered as Handler>::call`.

title: Fix doc

## Motivation

## Solution

Thank you for your Pull Request. Please provide a description above and review
the requirements below.

Bug fixes and new features should include tests.

Contributors guide: https://github.com/tokio-rs/axum/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md

## Solution

title: Add example for parsing body based on `Content-Type`
body:
Gotten a few questions from people trying to do

```rust
async fn handler(
    form: Option<Form<BTreeMap<String, String>>>,
    multipart: Option<Multipart>,
) {
```

basically parse the body based on the content-type.

I think writing a custom extractor that inspects the content-type and delegates the corresponding extractor is a good way to solve it. So this adds an example for that.

title: FromRequestParts does not have a 'B' type
[doc] Explicitely point out example's dependency
body:
## Motivation

While adopting Axum, I started by building a simple handler parsing Uuids from the path, as per the example. I spend a bit of time trying to figure out why the provided example doesn't compile: `uuid::Uuid` only implements `serde::Deserialize` if one enables the "serde" feature of the crate (which is not enabled by default).


## Solution

The error message generated is relatively opaque for an axum newbie, so this pull request adds a simple documentation update to point them in the right direction (and save them the trouble from using `axum-macros::debug_handler` themselves).

title: Bump version of all crates
body:
Lets get the release train going 🚀

I think we should look at https://github.com/tokio-rs/axum/pull/1054 during this week but I don't think it should block shipping the first rc.

title: Tweak `layer` and `route_layer` docs
body: Some minor tweaks to the docs for `layer` and `route_layer` methods. Mostly to make it more clear that middleware are added to existing routes.

title: Show path in panic message when merging overlapping `MethodRouter`s
body:
When you do

```rust
Router::new()
    .route("/foo/bar", get(handler))
    .route("/foo/bar", get(handler));
```

or

```rust
Router::new().route("/foo/bar", get(handler)).merge(
    Router::new().route("/foo/bar", get(handler))
);
```

The panic message will now contain the path (`/foo/bar`) so the error is hopefully easier to track down. Example:

```
Overlapping method route. Handler for `GET /foo/bar` already exists
```

It doesn't work for

```rust
Router::new().route("/foo/bar", get(handler).get(handler));
```

because the `get(_).get(_)` panics before `Router::route` is called so we don't know the path at that point.

title: Add `#[derive(FromRequestParts)]`
body: Resolves #1290.

title: Support turning any `Service` into a `MakeService`
body: Fixes https://github.com/tokio-rs/axum/issues/1120

title: Add `RequestExt` and `RequestPartsExt`
body: Fixes https://github.com/tokio-rs/axum/issues/1297

title: Document limitation with implementing both `FromRequest` and `FromRequestParts`
body: Documents the shortcoming discussed in https://github.com/tokio-rs/axum/pull/1299

title: Generate correct bound for non-last extractor in `#[debug_handler]`
body:
Fixes https://github.com/tokio-rs/axum/issues/1298

While working on this I also discovered another annoying possible bug. If you implement both `FromRequest` and `FromRequestParts` that wont work:

```rust
fn main() {
    let _: Router = Router::new().route("/", get(handler));
}

async fn handler(_: A, _: A) {}

struct A {}

#[async_trait]
impl<S, B> FromRequest<S, B> for A
where
    B: Send + 'static,
    S: Send + Sync,
{
    type Rejection = ();
    async fn from_request(req: Request<B>, state: &S) -> Result<Self, Self::Rejection> {
        unimplemented!()
    }
}

#[async_trait]
impl<S> FromRequestParts<S> for A
where
    S: Send + Sync,
{
    type Rejection = ();
    async fn from_request_parts(_parts: &mut Parts, _state: &S) -> Result<Self, Self::Rejection> {
        unimplemented!()
    }
}
```

This fails with

```
error[E0283]: type annotations needed
   --> hello-world/src/main.rs:16:46
    |
16  |     let _: Router = Router::new().route("/", get(handler));
    |                                              ^^^ cannot infer type for type parameter `M`
    |
note: multiple `impl`s satisfying `A: FromRequest<(), Body, _>` found
   --> hello-world/src/main.rs:24:1
    |
24  | / impl<S, B> FromRequest<S, B> for A
25  | | where
26  | |     B: Send + 'static,
27  | |     S: Send + Sync,
...   |
32  | |     }
33  | | }
    | |_^
    = note: and another `impl` found in the `axum_core` crate:
            - impl<S, B, T> FromRequest<S, B, axum_core::extract::private::ViaParts> for T
              where B: 'static, B: Send, S: Send, S: Sync, T: FromRequestParts<S>;
    = note: required because of the requirements on the impl of `Handler<(_, A, A), ()>` for `fn(A, A) -> impl Future<Output = ()> {handler}`
note: required by a bound in `axum::routing::get`
   --> /Users/davidpdrsn/dev/major/axum/axum/src/routing/method_routing.rs:400:1
    |
400 | top_level_handler_fn!(get, GET);
    | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ required by this bound in `axum::routing::get
```

There is no `#[debug_handler]` used here so its not the macros fault. However it doesn't improve the error either.

I'm not sure if this is something that can be fixed but might be worth exploring and possibly documenting.

---

I also added support for setting `AXUM_TEST_ONLY` to only run a single UI test. I often need to iterate on just one test and waiting for everything else to run is both slow and confusing since trybuild produces so much output.

Example usage:

```
AXUM_TEST_ONLY=tests/debug_handler/fail/doesnt_implement_from_request_parts.rs ca t --all-features -p axum-macros --lib debug_handler
```

title: axum-extra doesn't need to depend on axum-core

title: Port axum-extra
body: This ports the code and docs in axum-extra. `cargo t --all-features -p axum-extra` now passes. Getting closer 😊

title: Implement FromRequest[Parts] for tuples
body: This means that `FromRequest` is implemented for `(Method,)`, `(Bytes,)` as well as `((Method,),)` but not `((Bytes,),)`. I could add more impls such that that is allowed, but only up to a fixed level of tuple nesting.

title: Port docs for axum and axum-core
body: `cargo t --all-features -p axum -p axum-core` now passes 🎉

title: Port `#[derive(TypedPath)]` and `#[debug_handler]`
body: I'll do `#[derive(FromRequest)]` separately since it probably requires more work. We might even want `#[derive(FromRequestParts]` as well.
